title: Clinical Research Conduct and Management Certificate
summary: Dr. Richard Louie, the program director, provides information about the clinical research profession, career options, and how UC Berkeley extension can help launch a career in this field.

sub-topics.title: Clinical Research Profession
sub-topics.summary: Positions in clinical research are in high demand due to the growth in the biopharmaceutical and medical device industries.
quotes: Positions are increasingly in demand as the need grows for professionals to conduct and administer these studies.
The industry is seeing a need for clinical research Associates to manage domestic and global clinical studies.
Job opportunities and growth in this profession are positive with an upward trend.

sub-topics.title: Clinical Research Associate Profession
sub-topics.summary: Clinical research associates supervise, monitor, and support the administration and progress of clinical trials.
quotes: Clinical research associates serve as the liaison between the site investigator and the sponsor.
They ensure compliance with clinical trial protocol and the uniformity of data collection.
They ensure the research is being performed in a safe and ethical manner.

sub-topics.title: Salary and Career Advancement
sub-topics.summary: Entry-level clinical research associates in the San Francisco Bay Area earn a median salary of $70,000 per year.
quotes: Salary increases with experience and credentialing.
Clinical research managers earn a median salary of about $119,000 per year.
Experience and credentialing provide opportunities for advancement.

sub-topics.title: How to Become a Clinical Research Associate
sub-topics.summary: Steps to enter the clinical research profession include obtaining a bachelor's degree, developing core knowledge, gaining practical experience, and pursuing credentialing exams.
quotes: Recommended to have a bachelor's degree in a science or technical field.
Practical hands-on experience can be gained through internships or volunteering.
Credentialing exams are offered by the Association for Clinical Research Professionals and the Society of Clinical Research Associates.

sub-topics.title: UC Berkeley Extension's Clinical Research Conduct and Management Certificate
sub-topics.summary: UC Berkeley Extension offers a certificate program that provides a thorough foundation in clinical research skills and knowledge.
quotes: UC Berkeley Extension is the continuing education arm of UC Berkeley, offering Berkeley quality education.
The certificate program covers FDA regulations, good clinical practices, and practical procedural guidelines.
The curriculum consists of four required courses and can be completed in 8 to 12 months.

sub-topics.title: Course Formats and Enrollment
sub-topics.summary: Courses are available in online and hybrid formats, and enrollment can be done at any time.
quotes: Hybrid courses combine classroom and online instruction, allowing for in-person interaction.
Online courses have defined start and end dates with assignments and learning modules.
Courses can be taken individually or as part of the certificate program.

sub-topics.title: Internship Opportunities and Optional Courses
sub-topics.summary: UC Berkeley Extension helps connect students to internship opportunities and offers optional courses to further broaden knowledge.
quotes: Internship opportunities allow for practical work experience and building connections.
Optional courses include pharmacology, toxicology, biostatistics, and quality and compliance.
Additional courses can contribute to eligibility for credentialing exams.

sub-topics.title: Graduate Success Stories
sub-topics.summary: Recent graduates have secured positions in project management, clinical trials, and clinical science.
quotes: Graduates have found success in the industry and credit the certificate program for their achievements.
Employers value the certificate from a reputable institution.
The program provides a strong foundation and knowledge in all facets of clinical operations.

sub-topics.title: Program Registration and Completion
sub-topics.summary: Registration for the program is a one-time fee, and completion requires a grade of C or higher.
quotes: Registration is not required to start taking classes.
Registration can be done at any time, even after starting courses.
Completion of the program results in a certificate.
